intro: Huttonaea oreophila, commonly known as the mountain huttonaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or white. Huttonaea oreophila is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
